ageBand.description: Age is not adjusted for prematurity, and the criteria do not apply to birth hospitalizations, children with postconceptional age <37 weeks, or those aged ≥18 years.

respiratorySupport.description: Non-invasive respiratory support includes oxygen, high-flow, noninvasive positive pressure.

vasoactiveMedicationCount.description: Vasoactive medications include any dose of epinephrine, norepinephrine, dopamine, dobutamine, milrinone, and/or vasopressin (for shock).

lactateConcentration.description: Lactate can be arterial or venous.

meanArterialPressure.description: Use measured mean arterial pressure preferentially (invasive arterial if available or noninvasive oscillometric), and if measured mean arterial pressure is not available, a calculated mean arterial pressure (⅓ × systolic + ⅔ × diastolic) may be used as an alternative.

glasgowComaScale.description: The Glasgow Coma Scale score measures level of consciousness based on verbal, eye, and motor response and ranges from 3 to 15, with a higher score indicating better neurologic function.

hero.title: Welcome to SepsisCheck
hero.subtitle: Paediatric sepsis and septic shock diagnostic tool based on the Phoenix Sepsis Score and Criteria.

acknowledgements: Clinical guidance and support provided by Dr David Inwald. Spanish localisation provided by Emily Shelley.
privacyPolicy: SepsisCheck does not use cookies. Checks are saved to local storage and can be deleted by removing website data.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.short: SepsisCheck is an untested, proof-of-concept program and is not a substitute for professional medical direction and is built as a proof-of-concept.
disclaimer.full: SepsisCheck accepts no liability for any damages, losses, or consequences arising from the use of this tool. The application is provided “as is,” without any guarantees of accuracy, reliability, or suitability for medical decision-making. Use of SepsisCheck is at your own risk.
